title: Rufinus seems to have developed a school where he taught; Jerome ridicuíes his poor Latin and his pusillanimous teaching style (Jerome Let. 125). Jerome, besides his plentiful writings, worked for the preservation and dissemination of existing texts and tended a scriptorum for copying manuscripts; Rufinus criticises his extravagance in this respect and his readiness to pay more for the production of pagan classical authors (Jerome Apology Against Rufinus 2.8). 7 Paulinus Natalicia 21.60
